unit test WIP

this won't work.

I think you want to

```
reply.reserve(sizeof(size_t));
```
instead?
Ah, I didn't push my latest - meant to do reserve(length) the variable created above
also, this will just create one element. Instead of multiple `uint8_t`s. I am guessing that's what you were trying to do.
This is the size element then the insert after is the uint8_t bytes and it seems to work from testing - I'll add unit testes.

It will work fine if the size of `bmInstanceProperty` is less than 255. It will only start failing after it overflow.

oh, I guess you are only saying `uint8_t` worth of size and if that's the limit, then this will work as expected.
Oh yeah, I'm capping the read to 64 chars so it should be less than 255
Done
could just do `std::format("/run/bm-instance/{}", propertyTypeString)` instead.
Done

prefer to use stdplus fd managed if possible

http://github.com/openbmc/stdplus/blob/2f6affd1fdfe52c747a7e0917ab11ccdfa3866a8/include-fd/stdplus/fd/managed.hpp + https://github.com/openbmc/stdplus/blob/2f6affd1fdfe52c747a7e0917ab11ccdfa3866a8/include-fd/stdplus/fd/ops.hpp#L28

Can passing a span of size 64 and it will only read up to that size. But maybe that won't work as you wanted it.
Any chance I can clean this up in follow-up CL? I'll add a todo and clean up by EOW.
Acknowledged
